title: P127. Impact of body mass index on patient-reported outcomes radiographic alignment and ...

summary.text: **KEY FINDING**: BMI ≥35 correlated with higher in-hospital complications (2.0% vs 7.8%, p=0.032) and reduced postoperative pain relief.
**TACTICAL WIN [ROADMAP]**: Develop tiered follow-up protocols based on patient BMI to optimize care pathways.
**MARKET SIGNAL [⚫ CONTEXT]**: Rising obesity rates may shift PRO adoption focus toward managing weight-related surgical outcomes.
**CONCERN**: Patient self-selection bias in lower-BMI groups could skew perceived pain relief benefits, requiring validation studies.
